column2: ^20532210^4^1^"Simcity was a game that I held high hopes for
column3: only to be let down quickly when I actually was able to play it.

column1: The Always online was an annoyance
column2: one that looking back should have steered me away from the game all together. Game maker Maxis
column3: and EA assured us that was because calcualtions performed in the background required the server itself to do the heavy lifting. This was later admmited to be false
column4: as well as proven by the gamming community. Now they say that they had to make it online
column5: because it was their vision to do so. What about your customers visions of what a franchise was
column6: and should be?

column1: Aside from the horrible Online aspect
column2: the game itself has glaring flaws. (though Maxis is trying to work to improve them.)

column1: First and foremost is traffic issues
column2: the sims will always take the shortest path from point A to B
column3: even if that path is a two lane dirt road. Secondly
column4: the sims always start the day unemployed
column5: and fill in jobs starting with the closest to them. This too causes traffic congestion with every sim in the game going for one open job till it's full
column6: then onto the next closest.

column1: Fire trucks and other emergency vehicles spend all their time in traffic
column2: almost making their addition in your city pointless.

column1: I am sure within a few months
column2: all these points will be addressed and likely fixed. That doesn't take away from the fact that the game shipped out on day one
column3: was unplayable
column4: and as of this writing still is if you have any serious intentions to make a working city when playing."^2^March 19

^27831445^189^93^"I've been anxiously awaiting the release of The Sims 4 for quite some time. I was recently made aware of the missing pools and toddlers but I've been playing The Sims since the beginning so I decided I wasn't going to let that keep me from giving this game a shot.

column1: At last the game has arrived! I get on to play and start creating my sim
column2: the create a sim tool is great
column3: I mean it's missing some simple things from TS3
column4: like body hair but no biggie. So finally
column5: I'm done creating and I get to start playing... Select a house? Okay
column6: but why is this neighborhood all divided up into sections? Well... you can't simply travel around the neighborhood like before. What
column7: are you joking? No! Remember what it was like in TS2? It's like that
column8: loading screens to travel to and from a lot of places. Meh.

column2: let me just go get my usual job in the business career and it'll all be good. Nope
column3: you can't do that either
column4: sorry! My Sim just vanishes into thin air
column5: I can't see his needs or anything while he's gone. There are many other things that I've found missing from the game compared to previous versions.

column1: While the emotions of the sims are an interesting addition to the game
column2: they most certainly do not make up for the all of the things that are now missing. The graphics in my opinion are only slightly better than before.

column1: I remember the day the first Sims came out
column2: I was glued
column3: for hours and hours. It's only taken me about 3 hours to get bored with The Sims 4. Keep your money and stick with The Sims 3
column4: you'll be glad you did.

column1: I'll probably be returning my copy tonight via the Origin Great Game Guarantee because in my honest opinion
column2: the game is a very stripped down version of the Sims 3 that is not worth the price tag."^1^September 3
^27831445^189^33^"As a Sims player since the first one came out
column3: I think The Sims 4 is a great game. It runs beautifully on my 2 year old laptop on medium setting and it's not a gaming laptop nor anything close to it. The newer controls do take some time getting use to but it does have the option to revert to the Sims 3 controls so that's an easy fix if your having those issues. The graphics aren't as realistic as say GTA but with all the zany emotions and different sims running about I hardly notice. There are bugs
column4: as with any new game
column5: but so far EA has been prompt with dealing with them as they are brought to their attention. There aren't any pools or toddlers but the game is pretty fun without them. which I'm sure pools at least will be added later in a patch or something. Overall
column6: it's a pretty good game."^5^September 8

column3: I love this game. For those of you new to The Sims franchise
column4: it can be summed up as simply a good virtual life simulation game.

column2: I'll go into more detail:

column1: *Much faster loading screens than The Sims 3
*The things that are missing from base game (ghosts
column2: pools
column3: many careers) are being added FOR FREE in future patches (ghosts are already added - pools and careers are confirmed for November's patch and December's patch; the only thing not confirmed to be added that's missing is the toddler life stage
column4: and toddlers were annoying anyway)

column1: *Babies are basically attached to their cribs
column2: but there are many more social interactions you can do with them.

column1: *Moods add a level of realism to the game - I like it way better than just the moodlets of TS3 (moodlets contribute to moods in this game)
*It is NOT open world like TS3 was
column2: it's more like TS2 in that aspect (I personally rarely wanted to leave the house in TS3 anyway). However
column3: this is a huge contributor to what makes the loading screens so near-instant. It's also way less laggy than TS3 was in game.

column1: *Sims can look way more different than each other. They can actually look like different races. There's a bit of a learning curve with making adjustments in CAS (create-a-sim)
column2: but it really pays off if you like to have more variety in Sim appearances in your game. I've attached pictures of my first two Sims showcasing this. Namin is Korean
column3: and Jynette is black. You can also change body types a lot
column4: but I usually prefer to make thin-to-average-sized girls still.

column1: *Multi-tasking is a nice little convenience. It's usually best for talking to other Sims while doing other things (such as cooking or painting)
column2: but there are some other uses as well. My picture of Namin shows her having two drinks at once.

column1: *Ghosts are the color of their current emotion and have different abilities depending on how they died. I have not yet tested whether there are ghost babies in TS4.
*There are better buy and build-mode tools as well.
*I recommend downloading a faster gardening mod. You can get one from modthesims.
*There's too much other good stuff in this game to go on about
column2: you can buy it and discover for yourself
column3: or find a multitude of other information about it online.

column1: I was nervous about buying the game when I did
column2: because I heard negative things about it (mostly people complaining that it's not open-world)
column3: but once I played it
column4: I loved it way more than I loved TS2 even
column5: and that was my first Sims game. I hope this review was helpful to you. Good luck with your buying decision
column6: and happy simming! :)"^4^October 12

column2: and I wasn't excited at first. I wasn't going to play the game until I'd heard from someone else if it was worthwhile
column3: because I'd heard a ton about it
column4: and I was wary of the changes. After it came out
column5: I immediately started hearing good things
column6: and impulsively bought Sims 4 from my local Walmart
column7: keeping a firm grasp on my return policy receipt.

column2: was I surprised.

column1: Laptop mode runs beautifully on my 2 year old laptop
column2: without completely destroying the graphics. I've experienced almost no glitches or lagging
column3: even when my Sims' house is full of guests. The routing problems have all but disappeared
column4: and the new CAS and Build/Buy modes are beautiful.

column2: with all the positives
column3: some things have changed. There are WAY fewer lots to move into
column4: as most of them are full and there are only a few empty build lots in each world. The community lots are lacking
column5: and there is no open world. If you aren't interested in your Sims being extremely active hosts to a gaggle of individual friends
column6: this might not be the game for you.

column2: the new social system and multi-tasking abilities are a huge improvement
column3: but there are few lots
column4: and the community lots are a bit boring if you're used to the hustle and bustle of Sims 3's Bridgeport. Still
column5: worth a try if you're a casual Sims fan who wants an improvement on the lagging
column6: glitching
column7: awkward Sims of generations past."^4^September 10

^27831445^7^2^"Having been an avid player of Sims 2 and Sims 3 I decided to buy the Deluxe Edition when it came out for my wife and I (we play on separate computers in the same room when we do it).
'Wow the graphics are significantly better
column3: ' and
column4: 'oh this user design flow is really nice and the genetic feature is pretty nifty.' After that though everything seemed to just go down hill from there for me.

column1: The first thing that bothered me was the lot size. You really don't have an opportunity to have too many sims living near each other because there is a very small amount of room where you can build homes / businesses and after a few test runs you'll quickly find yourself out of room and needing to go to another neighborhood.

The second thing was really just the fact it didn't feel fun to manage this sim's life versus previous games. People grow up way too quickly so I end up not having enough time to really live the life. I'm playing a video game not some sort of inheritance simulator where you have to build up a family from rags to riches through the generations.
I just wish the magic of Sims 2 and 3 was there where I felt like I could make my character into whatever I wanted (a famous artist
column2: etc) without watching the other aspects of their life crumble because I was focused on a goal. I found if I wanted to get my character to the highest tiers I had to pretty much 1) invite lady friend over to talk while he works
column3: 2) fit a shower in after completing said work somehow
column4: 3) hope lady friend will clean the house for him while he falls asleep from exhaustion
column5: and then 4) begin the whole flow again; I feel like having my Sim succeed in this iteration is more of a chore. It'd have been survivable for me if the loading screens weren't everywhere and so slow which kills the environment but unfortunately they're terrible.

column1: I get how this can be fun to some people but as a legacy Sims user I just really don't get it. Maybe it's just me so take this with a grain of salt but I think EA really lost the mark here. There's fun to be had in the game just not by me."^2^November 21

column2: ^43816066^83^8^"I didn't exactly have low hopes for Sims 4's first expansion
column3: but I didn't expect it to be as fun as it is. I'm one of the types that has to mention I've been playing the Sims since the very first one. (Sorry) But I mention it because since the very beginning
column4: Sims fans have always wanted to control their working sims at that Sim's job. We finally get to do this and it could have turned out annoying or bad
column5: but didn't.

column2: there are three controllable careers
column3: plus you can open your own business and control it. I'll admit that's not much
column4: but anyone that's played an EA game knows that they'll milk our wallets for expansions. But don't hold that against The Sims. It's like that will all games these days.

column1: I won't reveal too much about Get To Work
column2: but I will say a few things. The careers you can control are medical
column3: scientist
column4: and detective (if you didn't know this yet). Just like when you go on dates in the base game
column5: with this you have objectives you can achieve at that Sim's job. You don't have to if you don't want to. If you want
column6: you can just play around with stuff at their job. You can even do construction at your workplace and edit the building or grounds. Or you can achieve the goals they give you which will help you get promoted faster.

column1: Now remember I said things could have been worse
column2: but turned out great? One example is that you don't HAVE TO follow your sim to work if you don't want to. If you'd rather focus on another sim from that family you can. If you don't follow your sim to work
column3: then it's just like it always has been where the sim's work performance will depend on their mood. So you don't have to controll them at their job if you would rather play another sim from that lot at their job
column4: or doing something else. I like that.

column1: I also like how I can load up another lot and be a customer at the other lot's job. Like I could open a business as one sim
column2: then later playing another lot
column3: I could go visit that same business and be it's customer. I didn't expect that.

column1: There's a ton of new items for our sims' homes-- more furniture
column2: decorations
column3: more interections
column4: etc. They improved existing interactions that came with the base game. Many new improvements to the existing stuff.

column1: I found that I was playing the game a lot more often after I had gotten this expansions. There's only a few complaints and they're very minor complaints. One is that I hate launchers. I hate having to load stuff before I can load the game. Another complaint is that when you're controlling a sim at their job
column2: the very second their work day ends
column3: the game automatically loads up their home lot again. You can't stay late at their job and finish a task or mess around with stuff. I hate being kicked off the work lot the second the work shift ends. My final complaint is the price of the expansion. I agree that it is overpriced. I blame Electronic Arts for that
column4: not the Sims creators.

column2: these are minor complaints. The expansion is still a lot of fun and improves Sims 4. Personally
column3: I'd recommend buying the disc version and not a digital download. If you ever have to reinstall the game
column4: you won't have to wait for the long download that would have to take place before the actual reinstall.

column1: If you've ever liked the Sims
column2: you'll like this. You just have to give it a chance and actually play it so you can see Sims 4 is the best one yet."^5^April 13
^43816066^9^1^"I've had Get to Work for about a year now

column4: baking skill
column5: and many other interactions. When I first bought the game I was very impressed and I had loads of fun playing with it during the first couple of months. After a while
column6: taking your sims to work became boring. The tasks you have to repeat are very repetitive
column7: this expansion can lose it's new game shine very quickly if you aren't into repeating things. You get a lot of new clothes
column8: hair
column9: and makeup in Create a Sim so that's a plus. They also have an alien life state
column10: your male sims can even get pregnant with an alien baby! That was very fun to play with. I would recommend getting this expansion
column11: but also look into getting Get Together so you can add something more once you get bored of this one. Overall is a good expansion adds something fresh to the base game
column12: but can get boring after you've done all the careers."^4^November 22

^16793184^14^6^"The Sims series is one that I have long enjoyed. Last Christmas when I was looking around for something to get myself
column3: it didn't take me long to decide. I had been enjoying the Sims 2 for quite some time
column4: so I decided to upgrade. I bought the combination of the base Sims3 as well as this expansion and one other.

column1: Gameplay itself is much improved. I quite like the additional features
column2: yet it still retained the familiarity of the Sims 2. The base game works just fine on my computer with no issues and very little lag.

column1: Then came the Pets. I was very excited about this part of the game
column2: because you finally get to control the pets the way you can the Sims themselves. It sounded like an amazing upgrade
column3: so as soon as Christmas came I eagerly installed and updated my game
column4: only to suffer extreme disappointment.

column1: Visit Youtube and you can readily find videos of the kind of distortion I was dismayed to find occurring in my game. It only seems to effect the pets themselves
column2: and only the cats
column3: dogs
column4: and horses at that. They simply don't render properly. Their images are horridly distorted such that one cannot even tell the species until a sound effect gives it away. Often some body parts will float some distance away or be turned around backwards altogether!

column1: It is impossible to enjoy playing with pets that look more like the result of a nuclear attack. I can't use what was one of my main motivations for playing the game. For the first few months
column2: owners of the Sims Pets expansion
column3: many of whom were suffering as I was
column4: were led to believe there would be a patch. I had faith that this was true
column5: and during this time bought the Sims Medieval as well.

column2: we were lied to. EA Games now says that it is not their problem
column3: and refuse to fix this glitch. My only option is to turn to third party software
column4: or just not play an expansion I have already paid $30 to get! There is a third party solution out there too
column5: so I know it is not just our computers. EA Games is being completely irresponsible and ignoring the needs of consumers of what is probably their most popular product. Sadly because of this I will not be buying anything more from them until I can see for sure that it works properly
column6: and I will definitely never buy until the cost goes down. I
column7: for one
column8: cannot afford to throw away another $30-40 on a product the company will not even ensure is working properly."^1^July 21

^5272734^1^6^"I have played wow since about 2 months after its release. And the expansion since the night of its release. In the beginning wow was a very very awsome experience. Your enemy would raid your cities and towns and you would do the same to them. The first pvp experience I had I will never forget. But........wow is not like it used to be. The best way I can describe this is the game is 20% fun and 80% grind and frustration. I have defeated every piece of content the burning crusade xpac has to offer ( yes that means i've killed illidan many times) And I will admit I had alot of fun but I've also felt like everytime I go to raid I'm doing a job that I dont want to do. The battleground option of the game is very fun about half the time. But most of the time you will find yourself on the opposite end of a 10 man team destroying you while the rest of your team is afk or they just arent trying to win. The pvp is very very imbalanced between all the classes making some of the classes WAYYYY overpowered compared to other classes even if you in the best gear ingame.

column1: If your looking for a fun game I would suggest looking elswhere. WoW at one time was a blast but now that has faded. Everytime you log on you will feel as if your going to work instead of logging on to have fun. This game is a waste of time and I feel bad that I've spent hundreds of dollars just to go to work and have a few moments of fun here and there. It costs about $180.00 to play this game yearly ontop of the 50-60 dollar cost of buying new xpacs. Be warned"^1^December 5

^37147047^3^2^"Tomb Raider: Anniversary is a 2007 action-adventure video game
column3: part of the Tomb Raider series. It is a remake of the first video game in the series
column4: the original 1996 Tomb Raider. It uses an improved version of the Legend game engine
column5: [3] and it includes all of the original environments from Tomb Raider.[3]

column1: The game was co-developed by Crystal Dynamics and Buzz Monkey Software for the PlayStation Portable
column2: PlayStation 2
column3: Windows and Wii.[4] Eidos announced 1 June 2007 as the European release date for the PS2 and Windows version
column4: with the North American release to follow on 5 June 2007.[5][6] Additionally
column5: the subscription PC gaming service GameTap announced that the game will be available on their service on the same day as the game went to retailers.[7] The PSP version was released on 9 August 2007 in the United States and on 26 October 2007 in Europe
column6: with the Wii version released in Europe on 7 December 2007.[8] An Xbox 360 version was released on 23 October 2007[9] and a version for the PlayStation 3 is included in The Tomb Raider Trilogy collection released in March 2011.[10] The Mac OS X version of the game was released in February 2008 by Feral Interactive.[1]

column1: The game was well received by critics
column2: with the PC version holding the highest score. It holds an 83 on Metacritic and 84.28% on GameRankings. The game sold 2.3 million copies worldwide.[11]"^3^June 15

column1: This is the 2nd expansion in the World of Warcraft series and allows you to travel to Northrend to battle against The Lich King Arthas. Northrend is a level 68+ area so you must have someone leveled at least that high to travel to the new realm.

If you have someone above level 55 then you can create the new Hero Class known as a Death Knight. As someone who has a level 70 Warrior at the moment I can tell you that I spent the first few hours of the release playing a Death Knight
column2: DE
column3: and found myself enjoying the new combat style of the death knight as well as playing a class that could tank things without a shield. If you do pick up the expansion I suggest you give this shot a try
column4: at least to play the new intro for the class and learn how this class came about into the lore of the WoW Universe.

column1: Overall there are many improvements on all fronts that make this title a great pick up for fans of the series that have already been playing for awhile. If you have yet to level someone above level 55 then there might not be much for you at the moment to enjoy."^5^November 14

^2432482^4^0^"Let me start by saying; This expansion is much better than 'Burning Crusade'

column2: and 'Burning Crusade' are also required. So
column3: unless you have those already
column4: I suggest starting with the original World of Warcraft game

column1: I would not personally recommend 'WoW' for anyone under age. The game does have some moral merit
column2: although many of those concepts are actually a little complicated for a child to comprehend and it is too easy for an unsupervised child to take the wrong course of action without consequence. It also contains violence
column3: and interaction with other players that provide a host of bad examples for children. The other problem with it for young children is that it takes a tremendous amount of time to accomplish anything
column4: and will interfere with their responsibilities
column5: such as homework and chores.

column2: I highly recommend this game for anyone between the ages of 18 and 100. My mother plays at the age of 83. She has been playing for over 5 years now and loves it! It provides her with hours of entertainment without leaving the comfort of her desk chair. This includes social interaction
column3: since the game is played via online connection to thousands of other players.

column1: These are my personal opinions of the game and do not reflect the intent of the makers
column2: nor are they designed to interfere with sales. I enjoy the game myself and endorse it for what I consider the proper age groups.
dive in
column3: and enjoy! It's a lot of fun and well worth the money considering the months and years of play you will get for it!"^5^September 7

column2: ^20532210^4^1^"Simcity was a game that I held high hopes for
column3: only to be let down quickly when I actually was able to play it.

column1: The Always online was an annoyance
column2: one that looking back should have steered me away from the game all together. Game maker Maxis
column3: and EA assured us that was because calcualtions performed in the background required the server itself to do the heavy lifting. This was later admmited to be false
column4: as well as proven by the gamming community. Now they say that they had to make it online
column5: because it was their vision to do so. What about your customers visions of what a franchise was
column6: and should be?

column1: Aside from the horrible Online aspect
column2: the game itself has glaring flaws. (though Maxis is trying to work to improve them.)

column1: First and foremost is traffic issues
column2: the sims will always take the shortest path from point A to B
column3: even if that path is a two lane dirt road. Secondly
column4: the sims always start the day unemployed
column5: and fill in jobs starting with the closest to them. This too causes traffic congestion with every sim in the game going for one open job till it's full
column6: then onto the next closest.

column1: Fire trucks and other emergency vehicles spend all their time in traffic
column2: almost making their addition in your city pointless.

column1: I am sure within a few months
column2: all these points will be addressed and likely fixed. That doesn't take away from the fact that the game shipped out on day one
column3: was unplayable
column4: and as of this writing still is if you have any serious intentions to make a working city when playing."^2^March 19

^27831445^189^93^"I've been anxiously awaiting the release of The Sims 4 for quite some time. I was recently made aware of the missing pools and toddlers but I've been playing The Sims since the beginning so I decided I wasn't going to let that keep me from giving this game a shot.

column1: At last the game has arrived! I get on to play and start creating my sim
column2: the create a sim tool is great
column3: I mean it's missing some simple things from TS3
column4: like body hair but no biggie. So finally
column5: I'm done creating and I get to start playing... Select a house? Okay
column6: but why is this neighborhood all divided up into sections? Well... you can't simply travel around the neighborhood like before. What
column7: are you joking? No! Remember what it was like in TS2? It's like that
column8: loading screens to travel to and from a lot of places. Meh.

column2: let me just go get my usual job in the business career and it'll all be good. Nope
column3: you can't do that either
column4: sorry! My Sim just vanishes into thin air
column5: I can't see his needs or anything while he's gone. There are many other things that I've found missing from the game compared to previous versions.

column1: While the emotions of the sims are an interesting addition to the game
column2: they most certainly do not make up for the all of the things that are now missing. The graphics in my opinion are only slightly better than before.

column1: I remember the day the first Sims came out
column2: I was glued
column3: for hours and hours. It's only taken me about 3 hours to get bored with The Sims 4. Keep your money and stick with The Sims 3
column4: you'll be glad you did.

column1: I'll probably be returning my copy tonight via the Origin Great Game Guarantee because in my honest opinion
column2: the game is a very stripped down version of the Sims 3 that is not worth the price tag."^1^September 3
^27831445^189^33^"As a Sims player since the first one came out
column3: I think The Sims 4 is a great game. It runs beautifully on my 2 year old laptop on medium setting and it's not a gaming laptop nor anything close to it. The newer controls do take some time getting use to but it does have the option to revert to the Sims 3 controls so that's an easy fix if your having those issues. The graphics aren't as realistic as say GTA but with all the zany emotions and different sims running about I hardly notice. There are bugs
column4: as with any new game
column5: but so far EA has been prompt with dealing with them as they are brought to their attention. There aren't any pools or toddlers but the game is pretty fun without them. which I'm sure pools at least will be added later in a patch or something. Overall
column6: it's a pretty good game."^5^September 8

column3: I love this game. For those of you new to The Sims franchise
column4: it can be summed up as simply a good virtual life simulation game.

column2: I'll go into more detail:

column1: *Much faster loading screens than The Sims 3
*The things that are missing from base game (ghosts
column2: pools
column3: many careers) are being added FOR FREE in future patches (ghosts are already added - pools and careers are confirmed for November's patch and December's patch; the only thing not confirmed to be added that's missing is the toddler life stage
column4: and toddlers were annoying anyway)

column1: *Babies are basically attached to their cribs
column2: but there are many more social interactions you can do with them.

column1: *Moods add a level of realism to the game - I like it way better than just the moodlets of TS3 (moodlets contribute to moods in this game)
*It is NOT open world like TS3 was
column2: it's more like TS2 in that aspect (I personally rarely wanted to leave the house in TS3 anyway). However
column3: this is a huge contributor to what makes the loading screens so near-instant. It's also way less laggy than TS3 was in game.

column1: *Sims can look way more different than each other. They can actually look like different races. There's a bit of a learning curve with making adjustments in CAS (create-a-sim)
column2: but it really pays off if you like to have more variety in Sim appearances in your game. I've attached pictures of my first two Sims showcasing this. Namin is Korean
column3: and Jynette is black. You can also change body types a lot
column4: but I usually prefer to make thin-to-average-sized girls still.

column1: *Multi-tasking is a nice little convenience. It's usually best for talking to other Sims while doing other things (such as cooking or painting)
column2: but there are some other uses as well. My picture of Namin shows her having two drinks at once.

column1: *Ghosts are the color of their current emotion and have different abilities depending on how they died. I have not yet tested whether there are ghost babies in TS4.
*There are better buy and build-mode tools as well.
*I recommend downloading a faster gardening mod. You can get one from modthesims.
*There's too much other good stuff in this game to go on about
column2: you can buy it and discover for yourself
column3: or find a multitude of other information about it online.

column1: I was nervous about buying the game when I did
column2: because I heard negative things about it (mostly people complaining that it's not open-world)
column3: but once I played it
column4: I loved it way more than I loved TS2 even
column5: and that was my first Sims game. I hope this review was helpful to you. Good luck with your buying decision
column6: and happy simming! :)"^4^October 12

column2: and I wasn't excited at first. I wasn't going to play the game until I'd heard from someone else if it was worthwhile
column3: because I'd heard a ton about it
column4: and I was wary of the changes. After it came out
column5: I immediately started hearing good things
column6: and impulsively bought Sims 4 from my local Walmart
column7: keeping a firm grasp on my return policy receipt.

column2: was I surprised.

column1: Laptop mode runs beautifully on my 2 year old laptop
column2: without completely destroying the graphics. I've experienced almost no glitches or lagging
column3: even when my Sims' house is full of guests. The routing problems have all but disappeared
column4: and the new CAS and Build/Buy modes are beautiful.

column2: with all the positives
column3: some things have changed. There are WAY fewer lots to move into
column4: as most of them are full and there are only a few empty build lots in each world. The community lots are lacking
column5: and there is no open world. If you aren't interested in your Sims being extremely active hosts to a gaggle of individual friends
column6: this might not be the game for you.

column2: the new social system and multi-tasking abilities are a huge improvement
column3: but there are few lots
column4: and the community lots are a bit boring if you're used to the hustle and bustle of Sims 3's Bridgeport. Still
column5: worth a try if you're a casual Sims fan who wants an improvement on the lagging
column6: glitching
column7: awkward Sims of generations past."^4^September 10

^27831445^7^2^"Having been an avid player of Sims 2 and Sims 3 I decided to buy the Deluxe Edition when it came out for my wife and I (we play on separate computers in the same room when we do it).
'Wow the graphics are significantly better
column3: ' and
column4: 'oh this user design flow is really nice and the genetic feature is pretty nifty.' After that though everything seemed to just go down hill from there for me.

column1: The first thing that bothered me was the lot size. You really don't have an opportunity to have too many sims living near each other because there is a very small amount of room where you can build homes / businesses and after a few test runs you'll quickly find yourself out of room and needing to go to another neighborhood.

The second thing was really just the fact it didn't feel fun to manage this sim's life versus previous games. People grow up way too quickly so I end up not having enough time to really live the life. I'm playing a video game not some sort of inheritance simulator where you have to build up a family from rags to riches through the generations.
I just wish the magic of Sims 2 and 3 was there where I felt like I could make my character into whatever I wanted (a famous artist
column2: etc) without watching the other aspects of their life crumble because I was focused on a goal. I found if I wanted to get my character to the highest tiers I had to pretty much 1) invite lady friend over to talk while he works
column3: 2) fit a shower in after completing said work somehow
column4: 3) hope lady friend will clean the house for him while he falls asleep from exhaustion
column5: and then 4) begin the whole flow again; I feel like having my Sim succeed in this iteration is more of a chore. It'd have been survivable for me if the loading screens weren't everywhere and so slow which kills the environment but unfortunately they're terrible.

column1: I get how this can be fun to some people but as a legacy Sims user I just really don't get it. Maybe it's just me so take this with a grain of salt but I think EA really lost the mark here. There's fun to be had in the game just not by me."^2^November 21

column2: ^43816066^83^8^"I didn't exactly have low hopes for Sims 4's first expansion
column3: but I didn't expect it to be as fun as it is. I'm one of the types that has to mention I've been playing the Sims since the very first one. (Sorry) But I mention it because since the very beginning
column4: Sims fans have always wanted to control their working sims at that Sim's job. We finally get to do this and it could have turned out annoying or bad
column5: but didn't.

column2: there are three controllable careers
column3: plus you can open your own business and control it. I'll admit that's not much
column4: but anyone that's played an EA game knows that they'll milk our wallets for expansions. But don't hold that against The Sims. It's like that will all games these days.

column1: I won't reveal too much about Get To Work
column2: but I will say a few things. The careers you can control are medical
column3: scientist
column4: and detective (if you didn't know this yet). Just like when you go on dates in the base game
column5: with this you have objectives you can achieve at that Sim's job. You don't have to if you don't want to. If you want
column6: you can just play around with stuff at their job. You can even do construction at your workplace and edit the building or grounds. Or you can achieve the goals they give you which will help you get promoted faster.

column1: Now remember I said things could have been worse
column2: but turned out great? One example is that you don't HAVE TO follow your sim to work if you don't want to. If you'd rather focus on another sim from that family you can. If you don't follow your sim to work
column3: then it's just like it always has been where the sim's work performance will depend on their mood. So you don't have to controll them at their job if you would rather play another sim from that lot at their job
column4: or doing something else. I like that.

column1: I also like how I can load up another lot and be a customer at the other lot's job. Like I could open a business as one sim
column2: then later playing another lot
column3: I could go visit that same business and be it's customer. I didn't expect that.

column1: There's a ton of new items for our sims' homes-- more furniture
column2: decorations
column3: more interections
column4: etc. They improved existing interactions that came with the base game. Many new improvements to the existing stuff.

column1: I found that I was playing the game a lot more often after I had gotten this expansions. There's only a few complaints and they're very minor complaints. One is that I hate launchers. I hate having to load stuff before I can load the game. Another complaint is that when you're controlling a sim at their job
column2: the very second their work day ends
column3: the game automatically loads up their home lot again. You can't stay late at their job and finish a task or mess around with stuff. I hate being kicked off the work lot the second the work shift ends. My final complaint is the price of the expansion. I agree that it is overpriced. I blame Electronic Arts for that
column4: not the Sims creators.

column2: these are minor complaints. The expansion is still a lot of fun and improves Sims 4. Personally
column3: I'd recommend buying the disc version and not a digital download. If you ever have to reinstall the game
column4: you won't have to wait for the long download that would have to take place before the actual reinstall.

column1: If you've ever liked the Sims
column2: you'll like this. You just have to give it a chance and actually play it so you can see Sims 4 is the best one yet."^5^April 13
^43816066^9^1^"I've had Get to Work for about a year now
column3: and what I can say is that it is a good addition to the base game. Your sims now have active careers and your able to follow your sims to work and complete tasks with them. You also can run your own store or business. You get the new photography skill
column4: baking skill
column5: and many other interactions. When I first bought the game I was very impressed and I had loads of fun playing with it during the first couple of months. After a while
column6: taking your sims to work became boring. The tasks you have to repeat are very repetitive
column7: this expansion can lose it's new game shine very quickly if you aren't into repeating things. You get a lot of new clothes
column8: hair
column9: and makeup in Create a Sim so that's a plus. They also have an alien life state
column10: your male sims can even get pregnant with an alien baby! That was very fun to play with. I would recommend getting this expansion
column11: but also look into getting Get Together so you can add something more once you get bored of this one. Overall is a good expansion adds something fresh to the base game
column12: but can get boring after you've done all the careers."^4^November 22

^16793184^14^6^"The Sims series is one that I have long enjoyed. Last Christmas when I was looking around for something to get myself
column3: it didn't take me long to decide. I had been enjoying the Sims 2 for quite some time
column4: so I decided to upgrade. I bought the combination of the base Sims3 as well as this expansion and one other.

column1: Gameplay itself is much improved. I quite like the additional features
column2: yet it still retained the familiarity of the Sims 2. The base game works just fine on my computer with no issues and very little lag.

column1: Then came the Pets. I was very excited about this part of the game
column2: because you finally get to control the pets the way you can the Sims themselves. It sounded like an amazing upgrade
column3: so as soon as Christmas came I eagerly installed and updated my game
column4: only to suffer extreme disappointment.

column1: Visit Youtube and you can readily find videos of the kind of distortion I was dismayed to find occurring in my game. It only seems to effect the pets themselves
column2: and only the cats
column3: dogs
column4: and horses at that. They simply don't render properly. Their images are horridly distorted such that one cannot even tell the species until a sound effect gives it away. Often some body parts will float some distance away or be turned around backwards altogether!

column1: It is impossible to enjoy playing with pets that look more like the result of a nuclear attack. I can't use what was one of my main motivations for playing the game. For the first few months
column2: owners of the Sims Pets expansion
column3: many of whom were suffering as I was
column4: were led to believe there would be a patch. I had faith that this was true
column5: and during this time bought the Sims Medieval as well.

column2: we were lied to. EA Games now says that it is not their problem
column3: and refuse to fix this glitch. My only option is to turn to third party software
column4: or just not play an expansion I have already paid $30 to get! There is a third party solution out there too
column5: so I know it is not just our computers. EA Games is being completely irresponsible and ignoring the needs of consumers of what is probably their most popular product. Sadly because of this I will not be buying anything more from them until I can see for sure that it works properly
column6: and I will definitely never buy until the cost goes down. I
column7: for one
column8: cannot afford to throw away another $30-40 on a product the company will not even ensure is working properly."^1^July 21

^5272734^1^6^"I have played wow since about 2 months after its release. And the expansion since the night of its release. In the beginning wow was a very very awsome experience. Your enemy would raid your cities and towns and you would do the same to them. The first pvp experience I had I will never forget. But........wow is not like it used to be. The best way I can describe this is the game is 20% fun and 80% grind and frustration. I have defeated every piece of content the burning crusade xpac has to offer ( yes that means i've killed illidan many times) And I will admit I had alot of fun but I've also felt like everytime I go to raid I'm doing a job that I dont want to do. The battleground option of the game is very fun about half the time. But most of the time you will find yourself on the opposite end of a 10 man team destroying you while the rest of your team is afk or they just arent trying to win. The pvp is very very imbalanced between all the classes making some of the classes WAYYYY overpowered compared to other classes even if you in the best gear ingame.

column1: If your looking for a fun game I would suggest looking elswhere. WoW at one time was a blast but now that has faded. Everytime you log on you will feel as if your going to work instead of logging on to have fun. This game is a waste of time and I feel bad that I've spent hundreds of dollars just to go to work and have a few moments of fun here and there. It costs about $180.00 to play this game yearly ontop of the 50-60 dollar cost of buying new xpacs. Be warned"^1^December 5

column5: [3] and it includes all of the original environments from Tomb Raider.[3]

column1: The game was co-developed by Crystal Dynamics and Buzz Monkey Software for the PlayStation Portable
column2: PlayStation 2
column3: Windows and Wii.[4] Eidos announced 1 June 2007 as the European release date for the PS2 and Windows version
column4: with the North American release to follow on 5 June 2007.[5][6] Additionally

column6: with the Wii version released in Europe on 7 December 2007.[8] An Xbox 360 version was released on 23 October 2007[9] and a version for the PlayStation 3 is included in The Tomb Raider Trilogy collection released in March 2011.[10] The Mac OS X version of the game was released in February 2008 by Feral Interactive.[1]

column1: This is the 2nd expansion in the World of Warcraft series and allows you to travel to Northrend to battle against The Lich King Arthas. Northrend is a level 68+ area so you must have someone leveled at least that high to travel to the new realm.

If you have someone above level 55 then you can create the new Hero Class known as a Death Knight. As someone who has a level 70 Warrior at the moment I can tell you that I spent the first few hours of the release playing a Death Knight
column2: DE
column3: and found myself enjoying the new combat style of the death knight as well as playing a class that could tank things without a shield. If you do pick up the expansion I suggest you give this shot a try
column4: at least to play the new intro for the class and learn how this class came about into the lore of the WoW Universe.

column1: Overall there are many improvements on all fronts that make this title a great pick up for fans of the series that have already been playing for awhile. If you have yet to level someone above level 55 then there might not be much for you at the moment to enjoy."^5^November 14

column3: it's par for the course.  When I pay $60-$80 for a full price retail game
column4: I don't expect to be bombarded with DLC
column5: Micro-transactions and the equivalent of online gambling with the loot crate scheme.

column1: Even more egregious is the fact that the game is blatantly PAY TO WIN.  You can spend thousands of hours (no joke) to unlock all of the hero characters
column2: or spend real money on loot crates for a chance to unlock them.  And speaking of loot crates
column3: people willing to spend the cash can level their characters up to unbeatable levels where they run around and completely decimate everybody who just wants to play the game they just spent $60-$80 for.

column1: There is a reason that after only a month
column2: the game has dropped $20 in price and it's NOT because it's a 'best-seller.'  It's because people are wising up and avoiding this train wreck.

column1: Speak with your wallet and don't be a sheep.  If you are willing to continue to pay for these money-grubbing schemes
column2: the likes of EA and Activision will continue to milk you of your hard earned cash."^1^January 7

column5: or even that god awful mess called Destiny 2. Then you should feel right at home. Now what makes this a great game is the sense of progression. Not by level(which is called HR in the game) but by gear. You can only progress through gear or you could say 'screw it' and probably finish 20% of the story without upgrading anything. But since you progress through gear that incentives players to grind and hunt for monsters. Which is only enhanced when you play with your friends. So the mechanics and gameplay of this grindy game make it unique and enjoyable but if you came here wanting a story i suggest getting another game like The Witcher 3 or Dark Souls."^5^February 23

column2: ^25394877^78^9^"For those who have suffered through sub-par racing games when various consoles have launched
column3: you won't have to do that with NFS: Rivals.

column1: NFS: Rivals takes the best parts of NFS: Hot Pursuit and makes them better. You've got two distinct tracks to go (Cops and Racers# up to 60 ranks
column2: and the game's map is open from the start. You progress by choosing and completing Speedlists. Some of them are very simply #'Bronze any Interceptor event'). Some
column3: near the end
column4: have 5-6 different requirements which all must be filled. Basically
column5: the game will force you to try all the tech options and force you to be consistant if you want to unlock all it has to offer.

column1: The newest edition to the series is AllDrive. This means that if you are playing single player and another driver is also playing single player
column2: you games could literally MEET in the same place at the same time. You might be on an interceptor event and see a race blow by you
column3: now it turns into a Hot Pursuit event! Busting human racers as a cop or getting away from a human cop definitely is the highlight of the title
column4: as some epic cat-and-mouse games can happen.

column2: you CAN play offline and free roam just fine. There are 80+ jumps & 80 + speed cameras to find. There are no billboards or gates like in NFS: Most Wanted
column3: so yes
column4: if you're one of those perfectionists/play a game to death people
column5: you might run through most of the content fairly quickly.

column1: But if you need a next-gen racing game that runs butter smooth with no lag
column2: that improves on one of the best NFS games ever released
column3: then NFS: Rivals is an outstanding choice."^5^November 22

column2: ^25185718^10^10^"This game rocks on the PS4. Earlier game glitches have been patched and repaired with the update. This game looks amazing on the PS4 running in 1080p. Everything runs smoother and faster on the 4. The offline game is well thought out and adds many new game playing roles. Flying helicopters and locking onto targets with the option of shooting missiles or spraying bullets while being locked onto by enemy choppers and having to launch anti missile flares all at the same time reaches a new level of difficulty and keeps you engaged in the game. I'm normally online only with COD games but this one has me playing the campaign daily. Be aware that in order to play Ghosts online (or pretty much all ps4 games) you will need a playstation plus membership. My copy of Ghosts came with a free trial of ps plus and it's well worth $50 a year. This game is much smoother and faster than the ps3 version."^5^January 3

^37789145^85^9^"Grand Theft Auto V is a very good game that has tons of content within it. The area that you can explore within the game is larger than all the other previous Grand Theft Auto games combined. The game centers around three characters Michael
column3: Trevor
column4: and Franklin. The game allows you to eventually jump between the characters and do missions that are exclusively tied to that character's storyline.

column1: The game is dense and looks beautiful. You will definitely get your money's worth with this game. You can probably put in over a 100 hours of gameplay if you want to. There is so much that you can do within the game
column2: for example you can go to a movie theater within the game and watch a short movie about a british robot who curses. There are tons of missions that you can do and I feel if you liked the previous GTA games you will love this one.

^24774751^6^2^"I own ever entry of this series and I love the direction they went with the gameplay. I have not finished the story mode
column3: so I will limit my comments on the story
column4: but so far it is inferior to the first games. The vastly improved naval battle mechanic brings so much to the world of Assassin's Creed that any new addition will feel almost naked without it. The map system is intuitive and easy to use and adds much to the open world gameplay. You perform specific missions that reveal items on the map which makes looking for items much less of a chore. The only problem I have is that many of the controlls are routed through the 'O' button and the game sometimes confuses what you want to do
column5: especially when entering swordfights. The button is used for both blocking during fights and sheathing the sword when not in fights. I have been hit many times because I went to block and my character ended up sheathing his sword. I played the X-box version and I have the same issue there. The triggers are not used in swordfights and I feels that they should return to using them to parry like in the first few games. Both systems also have a glitch that causes you to go to fighting with yyour fists if you transition between swords and pistols."^5^February 18

column2: ^49696163^3^0^"This game has great 3rd person
column3: action-RPG elements and a pretty fun loot system. The blend between genres is similar to that of the Borderlands series or Destiny. With a pretty solid amount of content and extras to explore
column4: you can guarantee at least 40-60 hours of fun PvE action. However
column5: if you are interested in the PvP combat--which is somewhat daunting due to high-leveled
column6: gear junky
column7: misfit campers--you can easily milk out another 100+ hours. This game was fun and held its interest for quite a while but it takes so many aspects from other games that I cannot help but feel slightly bored with the entirety of the game. It won't get that 5th star until it has demonstrated something that makes it truly unique from other iterations of this genre bending niche. The most unique aspect of the game
column8: in my opinion
column9: was the method of unlocking skills and passive abilities
column10: which is by upgrading a command center with useful accommodations.

column2: an interesting story
column3: some unique game mechanics
column4: and adequate length of interest."^5^April 25

^49972470^3^0^"AC Syndicate has so many improvements over Unity that it can be forgiven for its weak storyline. It is more of a GTA meets Batman set in the 1800's. The hard work that went into making it one of the most beautiful AC games is truly appreciated. This game is easily the 3rd best in the series after AC2 and Black Flag.

column1: So what did they do right.
Multiple ways to engage a mission
column2: i.e. stealth or brute force. And this time the stealth version works! (sorry Unity)

column1: Play as either male or female character outside the main missions. For some reason
column2: I found Evie easier to control.

column1: Return of the hidden blade. Now players can sneak up behind baddies and stab them in the back!
Grappling hook. Taking a play from the batman series it makes traveling around London fast and fun. Easily transitioning from rooftop to rooftop
column2: and nothing like dropping a smoke bomb and escaping a group of enemies.

column1: Different activities. This is really an open world game. There are so many activities to do including: Fight Club
column2: carriage racing
column3: cargo stealing
column4: cargo escorting
column5: and intercepting thieves.

column1: Outstanding graphics and visuals. The amount of detail put into this game just amazes me. The splash of a puddle while running down the street
column2: listening to a barber shop quartet
column3: a gazebo band play
column4: workers push around barrels as they toil the day away
column5: kids playing ball
column6: cats wondering the allies
column7: day night cycles
column8: weather cycles. Gone are the days of AC1's NPC rubbing his shoulder and grumbling.

column1: Better mission checkpoints in case you fail during a mission. No more restarting from the beginning.
Better controls when hijacking a carriage. Many times I had to hijack a carriage only to jump off the carriage instead. Bad design using the same button form hijack and jump off.
Better integration of the Animus and Templar storyline. Aside from a brief cinematic at the beginning and end
column2: the game had no relation to any of the AC games.

column1: The main story line was very disjointed
column2: switching between the two heroes made me stop caring after about the 4th mission.

column1: Better fast travel to the hideout. Hunting all over the map for the train icon is frustrating. There should have been a better way to get the hideout on the main map.
Better way to exit the train. Seriously
column2: trying to get off the train hideout is near impossible aside from going to the back and jumping off.

column1: Combat could use some improvement. It felt a button mash fest
column2: as countering an enemy's advance never seemed to be timed right.

this is a great game if you like open world activity games. It is more of an evolution than a revolution from prior games in the series. I definitely received my moneys worth out of the game."^5^February 6
^49972455^0^1^"It's a nice port
column3: but you can tell they didn't pay as much attention to some characters when it comes to the animation
column4: otherwise it's a priceless gem that looks a bit better on a cooler looking console."^4^June 3

column3: which he paid since this was a Christmas gift for our kids
column4: and it still didn't work. When he contacted EA via phone he waited for 2hrs before someone answered and they literally left him hanging on the line while the operator didn't talk and you could hear people laughing in the background. He said he waited for about 10mins with questions of 'hello? Anyone there? I need help please. Can anyone help? I can hear you...can someone please answer?' He finally hung up and then received an email 5mins later stating '...we tried calling you at the number you provided but there was no answer...' What?! Really?! We called you! He even sent an email to their customer service line with the complaint and a screen shot to show the duration of time he was on the phone with them but no response. So frustrating. Thankfully we got our money back from Walmart. Unfortunately
column5: we don't know how to get the $25 back we basically wasted trying to get it to work. Buyer beware. Don't waste your money trying to get it to work via the network. ^24928932^3^1^"In this game you are a master hacker who had one of your jobs go bad. Your family manages to get dragged into your mess and you're on a mission throughout the game to correct the wrongs/save yourself and your family.

column1: The storyline seems simple enough at first but then gets a little wacky. I don't want to spoil the plot but let's just say there were a few too many curveballs. For people who don't play every day
column2: it can be easy to forget the storyline or characters that were introduced the last time that you played.

column1: You basically have to use 3 things to beat this game: driving
column2: shooting
column3: and hacking.

column2: the driving in this game is really frustrating. I don't game much so I can't compare it to other games
column3: but the fast cars have almost zero steering handling. Nearly impossible to control (atleast for me) when I'm chasing or running from enemies.

column1: Shooting: You have a large selection of firearms to choose from plus some explosives. I had to engage in far more combat missions than I anticipated for this game but I loved them! I played the game on 'Normal' mode and still found the battles to be very challenging. You can't simply aim
column2: shoot
column3: and kill the enemy. Guns recoil
column4: targets move
column5: shoot back
column6: call for backup
column7: etc. In many missions you come under HEAVY fire. Enemies don't go down easy
column8: The shootouts are the best part of this game.

column1: Hacking: This was the reason that I bought the game. The hacking may be the easiest part of the entire game. I wish the game provided more of a challenge in the hacking/puzzle solving part of the game but I understand they have to appeal to a broad audience who are probably not computer geeks like myself.
I didn't even explore the online world
column2: but I do know that I was hacked by online players a few times in the game. I disabled that feature. There are a lot of side missions that you can play too. So you're not just stuck to the storyline.

column1: I give it 4 out of 5 stars because it managed to keep my attention and I have a very short attention span. It has a little bit of everything in it. Something for the people who like cars. Something for the people that like really in-depth story lines. Something for the people who like mystery or solving puzzles. It covers alot. A very good buy
column2: especially for the price."^4^May 28

^32427700^12^3^"Injustice: Gods Among Us is a great fighting game that you will love. I am almost finished with the story mode of the game and the story is very good. This version has some additional content and it only makes the game even stronger.

^25710672^18^38^"Graphically the game is great and the story is so-so. However the multiplayer is absolute garbage! I really do not understand why fanboys of this game act like the multiplayer is the best ever because it is FAR from that. The fixed spawning just begs for spawn campers to sit just at the right distance and pick you off as soon as you spawn. Another thing that annoyed me was that you could walk around a corner without knowing and step into the enemy base camp and you are instantly killed by one of the turrets.

column1: You can forget about running around the map and hitting the enemy hard as this game essentially encourages camping. 4 out of 8 games I played tonight the enemy team sat at their base camp protected by the default turrets the entire match. Needless to say it was boring and eventually I said enough was enough and quit this garbage game and will never play it again.

Great single player and great graphics but the multiplayer is just an absolute nightmare. And already trolls are about with their finger on the 'share' button to show off how stupid they are already on twitch which is intergrated into the PS4. Do yourself a favor and rent this first because if you are expecting this to be as good or better than Call of Duty Ghosts you will be sadly disappointed."^2^November 17

^33006932^16^1^"Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the most intricate and unique games I've ever played. However
column3: I may be a bit biased because I absolutely love everything Witcher. I have read every English translated Witcher book there is
column4: as well as played all of the games. The first thing you will probably notice about CD Projekt Red's latest masterpiece is its astonishing and mind-blowing graphics. I will confess that the previously mentioned graphics are a bit of a downgrade from the teaser we saw in 2013
column5: but it's not enough to make it unworthy of buying.

column1: The world of the Witcher 3 is by far the most stunning thing I've ever witnessed in a game. The complaint I read the most is that the combat is really hard and not very well put together
column2: when playing on console. Having played previous Witcher games the control scheme wasn't much of a stretch from what I was used to
column3: but I see where other people are coming from. The problem with gamers today
column4: is that we've almost no patience. If you actually read the tutorials and take your time you'll get used to the game in no time flat. I hate to be blunt
column5: but Witcher 3 is not a game for the weak or ignorant player. It takes time
column6: charisma
column7: and a bit of finesse
column8: but is well worth it.

column1: In my opinion the most important aspect of a good RPG is the story. When I play the Witcher main quests
column2: side quests
column3: and sometimes even contracts
column4: it is one of the most immersive and fun games I have played in a long time. Before Dragon Age: Inquisition released I was so excited for to play it. However
column5: after you annihilate the campaign a few times it can be really boring. Witcher 3 is not like that. The campaign takes way longer than that of most role playing games
column6: yet manages to keep you excited
column7: intrigued
column8: and surprised. The last thing I should mention is the open-world of this game. The size of Skyrim? Maybe not
column9: but this Multi-Region world is so huge there is a good chance you'll never see all of it. The fact that the Witcher's open-world is close to the size of Skyrim's and doesn't have an abundance of in traversable mountains
column10: is why I'd say Witcher 3 has a better world."^5^June 7

column2: ^33006932^8^1^"Map: very vast
column3: tons of things to do and explore.

column2: especially for such a large game.
so that when the few glitches in gameplay happen and you're forced to quit no matter your last save
column3: you don't lose any progress.

column2: and the feature which tells you what level you ought to be before attempting a quest is accurate.
way too much fun. I can't get anything done. I'm addicted.
even though it's Witcher 3
column3: even if you haven't played the previous ones - like me - you aren't lost in the story.

column2: and just FYI... they say to run the other way when an enemy has a red skull by its title. Follow that advice. Especially if there's more than one."^5^July 1

^24928932^3^1^"In this game you are a master hacker who had one of your jobs go bad. Your family manages to get dragged into your mess and you're on a mission throughout the game to correct the wrongs/save yourself and your family.

column1: The storyline seems simple enough at first but then gets a little wacky. I don't want to spoil the plot but let's just say there were a few too many curveballs. For people who don't play every day
column2: it can be easy to forget the storyline or characters that were introduced the last time that you played.

column1: You basically have to use 3 things to beat this game: driving
column2: shooting
column3: and hacking.

column2: the driving in this game is really frustrating. I don't game much so I can't compare it to other games
column3: but the fast cars have almost zero steering handling. Nearly impossible to control (atleast for me) when I'm chasing or running from enemies.

column1: Shooting: You have a large selection of firearms to choose from plus some explosives. I had to engage in far more combat missions than I anticipated for this game but I loved them! I played the game on 'Normal' mode and still found the battles to be very challenging. You can't simply aim
column2: shoot
column3: and kill the enemy. Guns recoil
column4: targets move
column5: shoot back
column6: call for backup
column7: etc. In many missions you come under HEAVY fire. Enemies don't go down easy
column8: The shootouts are the best part of this game.

column1: Hacking: This was the reason that I bought the game. The hacking may be the easiest part of the entire game. I wish the game provided more of a challenge in the hacking/puzzle solving part of the game but I understand they have to appeal to a broad audience who are probably not computer geeks like myself.
I didn't even explore the online world
column2: but I do know that I was hacked by online players a few times in the game. I disabled that feature. There are a lot of side missions that you can play too. So you're not just stuck to the storyline.

column1: I give it 4 out of 5 stars because it managed to keep my attention and I have a very short attention span. It has a little bit of everything in it. Something for the people who like cars. Something for the people that like really in-depth story lines. Something for the people who like mystery or solving puzzles. It covers alot. A very good buy
column2: especially for the price."^4^May 28

column2: ^55781563^0^1^"I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my nephew. After looking for the best deal at various stores
column3: Walmart's pricing was 25.00 less than their competitors.

column2: it's not perfect but one of the better Maddens in recent years. Madden 18 may not be perfect in all areas of the game
column3: but it's a solid game that keeps improving. Commentary
column4: presentation and graphics are better than ever before. EA's Frostbite engine may not have been implemented as well as it could have been
column5: but for a first year effort
column6: it's a solid foundation that should improve. The PS4 Pro enhancements truly change this game for the better. Having a solid 60 frames per second on 1080P resolution and amazingly clear HDR graphics on 4K televisions truly makes a ton of difference over 17 and previous years. Franchise hasn't seen a lot of improvements come its way
column7: but its minor fixes to commentary and menu quirks perfect what was already there. Here's hoping for an overhaul in 19. Longshot is a surprisingly fun story mode that ends far too soon. I honestly hope an NFL-based sequel that uses your save data from Madden 18 will be added next year
column8: instead of a completely new story with new characters. All things considered
column9: this is a solid game that
column10: in spite of its imperfections
column11: does a lot to emulate what fans see on Sundays. It could be better. But what's there is certainly admirable
column12: and hopefully it continues to improve next season under Frostbite."^5^December 26

column2: ^45589070^131^47^"Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 will most likely be the last game released for the XBox 360 which is why you should at least be happy that it's a solid multiplayer game with a side of Zombies to boot.

column1: The multiplayer Beta included a wealth of multiplayer content to unlock once you reach a certain level. Since there's no Campaign
column2: multiplayer has a lot to hold up on its own (and mostly succeeds) although it could use some fine tuning. Some specialist abilities are OP (over-powered) while others barely do anything in combat. Certain weapons (Razorback & M8A7) dominate the battlefield and if you use a more unpopular gun
column3: you'll get slaughtered by those two aforementioned guns. When Treyarch (the developer) releases more patches to fix things in the multiplayer
column4: it should be astronomically better.

column2: sadly
column3: isn't at its best this year. With a mediocre base game map (Shadows of Evil)
column4: there isn't much to say about Treyarch's fan favorite mode.

column2: Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 is a solid game that simply needs some fine tuning before the base game is launched November 6th."^3^October 17

^45589070^45^25^"I am a big COD fan I always pre-order their new games but COD Black Ops III has been the biggest disappointment for many reasons.

column1: First of all I really don't like how this version does not have the campaign. I am paying a lot of money for the game and it should have the same things all the other systems have.
The lag on this game is awful I get kicked out of games all the time and my game freezes constantly.
The most annoying part is how long it takes to get into a game on zombies it takes me anywhere from 30 minutes to several hours .

There are also issues with the gun customization i will set up my guns but they are not that way when I get them on the map and sometimes my game even FREEZES or I get connection interrupted and kicked from the game if I pick up a gun.
Multiplayer is the same you almost never get to play a full game you either lag out or your game freezes it is very irritating.
For all these reasons I would have to say that I would not recommend this game it is just a waste of money!"^1^December 12

^52599732^0^12^"As much as I enjoyed the first Titain Fall game this year was no more then unessisary. From a over hyped game such as BF1 and COD IW it was just underwhelming. For me it fell short of even 2 stars I'm just optimistic. This game is great if you just started playing video games but over the years its simply lacking in content and replay value it fun in the moment but also forgettable in the same light.  If you do plan of purchasing this game I urge my fellow gamers who look for specific things you like in your gaming experiences and to play the demo first or rent this game first before hand. As long as you know what you like and exspect in a game from story to gameplay you should be fine. As for sheeple aimlessly buying this game for the sake of buying a game best if luck to you. For this time around I rate a 2 Star. I simply expected more from a rightfully underrated game that is no more then a COD title of 2016."^2^December 24

^25710672^18^38^"Graphically the game is great and the story is so-so. However the multiplayer is absolute garbage! I really do not understand why fanboys of this game act like the multiplayer is the best ever because it is FAR from that. The fixed spawning just begs for spawn campers to sit just at the right distance and pick you off as soon as you spawn. Another thing that annoyed me was that you could walk around a corner without knowing and step into the enemy base camp and you are instantly killed by one of the turrets.

column1: You can forget about running around the map and hitting the enemy hard as this game essentially encourages camping. 4 out of 8 games I played tonight the enemy team sat at their base camp protected by the default turrets the entire match. Needless to say it was boring and eventually I said enough was enough and quit this garbage game and will never play it again.

Great single player and great graphics but the multiplayer is just an absolute nightmare. And already trolls are about with their finger on the 'share' button to show off how stupid they are already on twitch which is intergrated into the PS4. Do yourself a favor and rent this first because if you are expecting this to be as good or better than Call of Duty Ghosts you will be sadly disappointed."^2^November 17

^33006932^16^1^"Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the most intricate and unique games I've ever played. However
column3: I may be a bit biased because I absolutely love everything Witcher. I have read every English translated Witcher book there is
column4: as well as played all of the games. The first thing you will probably notice about CD Projekt Red's latest masterpiece is its astonishing and mind-blowing graphics. I will confess that the previously mentioned graphics are a bit of a downgrade from the teaser we saw in 2013
column5: but it's not enough to make it unworthy of buying.

column1: The world of the Witcher 3 is by far the most stunning thing I've ever witnessed in a game. The complaint I read the most is that the combat is really hard and not very well put together
column2: when playing on console. Having played previous Witcher games the control scheme wasn't much of a stretch from what I was used to
column3: but I see where other people are coming from. The problem with gamers today
column4: is that we've almost no patience. If you actually read the tutorials and take your time you'll get used to the game in no time flat. I hate to be blunt
column5: but Witcher 3 is not a game for the weak or ignorant player. It takes time
column6: charisma
column7: and a bit of finesse
column8: but is well worth it.

column1: In my opinion the most important aspect of a good RPG is the story. When I play the Witcher main quests
column2: side quests
column3: and sometimes even contracts
column4: it is one of the most immersive and fun games I have played in a long time. Before Dragon Age: Inquisition released I was so excited for to play it. However
column5: after you annihilate the campaign a few times it can be really boring. Witcher 3 is not like that. The campaign takes way longer than that of most role playing games
column6: yet manages to keep you excited
column7: intrigued
column8: and surprised. The last thing I should mention is the open-world of this game. The size of Skyrim? Maybe not
column9: but this Multi-Region world is so huge there is a good chance you'll never see all of it. The fact that the Witcher's open-world is close to the size of Skyrim's and doesn't have an abundance of in traversable mountains
column10: is why I'd say Witcher 3 has a better world."^5^June 7

column2: ^33006932^8^1^"Map: very vast
column3: tons of things to do and explore.

column2: especially for such a large game.
so that when the few glitches in gameplay happen and you're forced to quit no matter your last save
column3: you don't lose any progress.

column2: and the feature which tells you what level you ought to be before attempting a quest is accurate.
way too much fun. I can't get anything done. I'm addicted.
even though it's Witcher 3
column3: even if you haven't played the previous ones - like me - you aren't lost in the story.

column2: and just FYI... they say to run the other way when an enemy has a red skull by its title. Follow that advice. Especially if there's more than one."^5^July 1

^44782723^2^7^"This review is for the XBOX One version of Star Wars Battlefront.
I'm a huge fan of Star Wars and have played all of them going back to the first 1980s arcade versions. Now that being said
column3: I can tell you that the game controls are HORRIBLE
column4: the WORST I've ever used in any Star Wars game
column5: especially for the flying vehicles.

column1: You cannot map individual control buttons. The one that bugs me the most is the left or right stick as your only choice your power/speed control button. It would be much better if it could have other button options like being on one of the trigger buttons. Also
column2: the flying vehicles are very mushy and erratic when compared to games like Ace Combat
column3: HAWX
column4: and even the 1983 arcade version of Star Wars. Basically
column5: I find many of the controls for this game somewhat clumsy.

column2: I bought it at Game Stop and when I tried to return it after 5 days they refused. They only allow used games to be returned within 7 days
column3: so GAME STOP BUYERS BEWARE! If you must have it
column4: wait and get it used from Game Stop so you can return it within 7 days if unhappy
column5: or get it from someone who has a fair return policy. Also there are a lot of video glitches in the cut scenes and in the game play. I'M VERY FREAKING UNHAPPY WITH THIS GAME!"^2^December 18
